author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Watch: The first trailer for the TV movie on Prince Harry and Meghan is here
summary: If you thought the marriage of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle WASN'T going to get the Lifetime TV Movie treatment, you're living in a dream world. Of course it was. It was preordained by God Almighty and was destined to happen from the very split-second that the marriage was announced. In fact, you could put cash money down and bet that the film was greenlit the very day the marriage was announced. The TV movie stars Parisa Fitz-Henley, who was in Marvel's Luke Cage, as Meghan Markle and Australian actor Burgess Abernethy - which if you told us was a Sherlock Holmes villain, we'd believe you - as Prince Harry. It premieres on Lifetime on May 13th and will likely do the rounds online shortly thereafter.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Box Office: 'Black Panther' Has Become Hollywood's Worst Nightmare
summary: 'Black Panther' has crushed an entire slate of pre-summer event movies leaving the rest of the industry fighting for scraps.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Lifetime's Harry & Meghan: A Royal Romance Is About to Be Your New Guilty Pleasure
summary: We already saw the photos of Lifetime's upcoming original movie, Harry & Meghan: A Royal Romance, but now we have a trailer to feast our eyes on. In the 20-second clip, we see Prince Harry, played by the handsome Murray Fraser, making his move on Meghan Markle, played by Parisa Fitz-Henley. Watch the full trailer above, then see how the cast of the movie compares to the real-life royals. And don't worry, we won't tell anyone this is about to become your new guilty pleasure when it airs in May — right in time for the royal wedding!

author: captainunderoos
title: ‘Captain Marvel’ Movie: What We Know So Far
summary: It's been a long wait, but Marvel's first female-led superhero film is finally on the horizon. Here are a few things we know so far about 'Captain Marvel.'

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: How Zack Snyder May Have Teased Justice League 2 In Batman V Superman
summary: As noted by Josh Costella on Vero (a go-to source for Snyder-related DC information lately), Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice features a clear shot of three crosses in the background of the scene in which Batman (Ben Affleck) and Wonder Woman (Gal Gadot) lay the body of Superman (Henry Cavill) down after the fight against Doomsday. Though it may seem like nothing more than an interesting shot, Zack Snyder actually commented on the picture and noted that "that's a reference to Justice League 2," i.e. he intended to use this as foreshadowing for something that would eventually happen in his second Justice League movie, "#untilitwasnt." As fans already know, that's not how things shook out, and

author: nanook
title: Infinity War's Doctor Strange Torture Recreates A Dangerous Comic Moment
summary: Thanks to the latest look at Avengers: Infinity War, we know another big moment from the comics will be in the film – which is bad news for Doctor Strange. When it comes to Marvel adapting coming storylines for the comics, they often use them as broad inspiration. Naturally, the MCU is a different universe than the one on the page, so fans generally get homages and Easter eggs rather than exact copies. A key Silver Surfer moment will be in Avengers 3, but with the Hulk subbing in and kicking off the story like the cosmic hero did in Infinity Gauntlet. There's no telling how many moments from Infinity Gauntlet and Infinity War will be in Avengers 3, but another comic seems to have a big influence

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Jordan Peele hilariously accepted the congratulatory messages meant for Jordan Poole
summary: Michigan freshman Jordan Poole hit the shot of the tournament on Saturday when his circus shot from 3 downed Houston at the buzzer. As expected, Poole's phone was blowing up after the game. It turns out Oscar-winning comedian Jordan Peele had the same issue. On Sunday, Peele took to Twitter and accepted all the congratulatory messages meant for Poole after that Michigan buzzer-beater. All those hours spent in the gym certainly paid off. Oh, wait. The actual hero from the Michigan-Houston game noticed the tweet, and it's fair to say that Poole was pumped about the shoutout.

author: DeltaBravo
title: NCAA tournament odds: Duke is the new Vegas favorite, with Villanova close behind
summary: After four days of upsets, Las Vegas has a new favorite team to win the NCAA tournament.

author: third_watch
title: The Worst Casting Choices of All Time
summary: Whether they're distracting, offensive, or just downright bad, casting mistakes have been responsible for ruining entire films and series.

author: captainunderoos
title: ‘Deadpool 2’: Everything We Know So Far
summary: 'Deadpool 2' is a ways away from its premiere, but we don't have to wait until then to learn more about the anticipated sequel. Here's what we know so far.

title: Netflix Reveals 10 Horror Movies Viewers Were Too Scared to Finish
summary: The nightmares are real.

author: captainunderoos
title: Ellen Barkin tweets #MeToo accusation about Terry Gilliam in response to his controversial Weinstein remarks
summary: The actress spoke out against her 'Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas' director after he criticised the #MeToo movement and victims of Harvey Weinstein.

author: third_watch
title: 15 Hilarious Darth Vader VS Kylo Ren Memes
summary: The Star Wars franchise is as strong today as it ever was. The world that George Lucas created — and others like J.J. Abrams and Rian Johnson have continued — has amassed fans in the millions. People from different generations flock to see new Star Wars stories in the theater and on DVD or streaming services like Amazon. And of course, fans take the time to create funny memes blasting or praising their favorite characters. Kylo Ren (Adam Driver) has been the center of some mild controversy, as fans decide whether he's a hardcore bad guy worthy of the Darth Vader mantle, or a petulant brat with a chip on his shoulder. In their own ways, both Vader and Ren are overly pessimistic and selfish. But

author: DeltaBravo
title: The "Fantastic Beasts 2" teaser trailer might have revealed a *major* spoiler — and it involves the Lestrange family
summary: The teaser trailer for Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald finally arrived last week, and it may have brought some spoilers with it. If you don't want even a *hint* of Fantastic Beasts 2 spoilers, turn back now! OK, is everyone else ready? Great. A major Fantastic Beasts 2 spoiler is maybe hiding in plain sight in the film's teaser, and no joke, it's juicy AF. Eagle-eyed fans who paused the Fantastic Beasts 2 teaser at the exact right moment would notice a *possible* key to unlocking the sequel. In one brief moment, it appears that Young, Hot Dumbledore is studying the Lestrange family tree. Yes, those Lestranges. As in, Bellatrix Lestrange, Sirius Black, possible Newt Scamander love

author: third_watch
title: Renée Zellweger as Judy Garland, and 11 other actors who looked exactly like their real-life counterparts
summary: Hollywood loves to cast illustrious stars as famous historical figures, even though it doesn’t always care if the former necessarily resembles the latter (see, for instance, 2015’s Steve Jobs, in which Michael Fassbender doesn’t look much like the Apple visionary). That’s most definitely not the case with the upcoming biopic Judy, in which Renée Zellweger will step into the legendary shoes of Judy Garland — a role that, as proven by today’s first photo from the production, will benefit from the fact that Zellweger is nearly indistinguishable from the cinematic icon. Inspired by that stunning snapshot’s debut, we’ve compiled a rundown of the finest instances of actors becoming the spitting image of their real-life artist and politician characters.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Steven Spielberg Reveals ‘Indiana Jones 5’ Production Start Date
summary: Steven Spielberg has teased the production start date for “Indiana Jones 5,” saying that he will start filming the next adventure next spring. “It’s always worth the trip when I get to work with this deep bench of talent coming out of the UK,” Spielberg said during his acceptance speech, according to ComicBook.com. Previously dated for July 19, 2019, the film was pushed to open on July 10, 2020. Spielberg is set to return to direct and executive produce star Harrison Ford.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Best Surprise Avenger Team-Ups We're Excited For
summary: One of the most anticipated parts of Avengers: Infinity War is the chance to see all of our favorite heroes sharing a screen for the first time. Marvel has been building to this team up for the past 10 years, creating an intricate shared universe across 18 movies. The studio has a formula: they start with solo films for characters, giving them individual powers and challenges before bringing them together to face greater threats. The first major team-up was The Avengers in 2012, which was later followed by Avengers: Age of Ultron in 2015. Most recently our heroes were brought together not to fight an external threat, but each other in Captain America: Civil War. Civil War was the first tease

author: third_watch
title: The New 'Avengers: Infinity War' Trailer Is Beautiful Chaos
summary: This movie somehow looks even bigger than expected. This morning, Marvel Studios dropped the brand new, full-length trailer for Avengers: Infinity War, and hoo boy: This movie is going to be big. You might want to watch this a few times. If you're having trouble keeping up with all the various threads of this trailer, you're not alone. Captain America's hiding out in Wakanda, it looks like, and has a new shield. Tony Stark and Star-Lord have a smug-off, naturally. Spider-Man roasts Doctor Strange. Tons of stuff flies around and gets blown up. Frankly, this looks like a deranged mess of a movie. I could not be more thrilled. We spend a lot of time with Thanos, too—Josh Brolin's CGI Mad Titan who,

author: DeltaBravo
title: You Can Update Your Bag to Look Like Angelina Jolie's For Less Than $100
summary: There was something different about Angelina Jolie's typical "uniform" as she headed to see a movie in Hollywood with her children. Instead of keeping it simple and sleek in all black, Angelina incorporated a bold flash of red thanks to the clip-on shoulder strap on her Salvatore Ferragamo bag ($2,220). She wore her usual staples, including a long trench, Aquatalia Dena boots, and dark sunglasses, but it was the addition of that one accessory that held our attention and confirmed the star is up on the latest trends. In fact, there are so many different straps you can affix to your purse to achieve a playful street style look, from Fendi Strap You designs to more affordable snakeskin versions

title: These Major 2018 Films Are Destined for Failure
summary: From 'Robin Hood' to 'Alita,' these are the movies being released in 2018 that will likely disappoint audiences and lose a lot of money.

title: ‘Black Panther,’ ‘Tomb Raider,’ a Gay Romance, and a Christian Breakout Couldn’t Save the Box Office
summary: "I Can Only Imagine," the faith-based drama from Andrew and Jon Erwin, is the sleeper success of the year.

author: nanook
title: Shia LaBeouf to play his father in movie based on his own life
summary: Shia LaBeouf will draw upon his own painful life experience in new drama Honey Boy, playing his 'law-breaking, alcohol-abusing father'. The movie is loosely based on the actor's life, according to Variety who broke the news, telling the story of a child star trying to mend a broken relationship with his father over the course of a decade. Manchester by the Sea's Lucas Hedges will play the younger version of LaBeouf, though Hedges is only 10 years his junior.

author: DeltaBravo
title: The Matrix 4 May Feature Entirely New Characters
summary: We learned last year that Warner Bros. is planning on rebooting The Matrix, but it appears as if those reports may have been somewhat premature. And that's because, along with the reveal that Michael B. Jordan is being eyed to star, we also heard that Zak Penn (Ready Player One) is writing a treatment, though he's since clarified that his take on the beloved property will neither reboot nor remake it. So, what exactly can we expect, then? Well, we're still not sure, but from what we understand, Warner Bros. is working to put together a writer's room (the new trend in Hollywood these days) in hopes of figuring out “the best possible way to relaunch the franchise.” It makes perfect sense that they're

author: third_watch
title: The Ten Horror Movies Netflix Says Are So Scary, Viewers Can't Finish Them
summary: Last week I wrote about Veronica, a Spanish horror film about an Ouija board demon haunting a family. It has a great cast, but I found it to be a bit bland overall. I may be in the minority opinion there, however, as the film was being sold as “so terrifying that Netflix users were saying they had to turn it off.” Well, it turns out that may be a fairly common thing. Netflix has actually just sent me a list of ten films that their data shows them are similarly scary/horrifying that their users can't actually make it all the way through them. The criteria was that Netflix users made it at least 70% of the way through the movie, but turned it off en masse before finishing it. So if you want a horror

author: DeltaBravo
title: Benedict Cumberbatch Broke A Big Rule On The INFINITY WAR Set
summary: In today's digital age, it's undeniably harder to keep spoilers under wraps than ever before. Years ago, we had to wait for which of our favorite magazines had the latest exclusive to hit stands, but now, anyone with a cell phone has the potential to leak the juiciest of information onto the internet. Thus, it's very much understandable that the folks at Marvel Studios keep their cards as close to their vest as humanly possible when it comes to anything regarding Avengers: Infinity War. And while none of us outside the blockbuster movie's production have laid eyes on the script, you'd think that those starring in it know the score, right? Well, apparently not. As you've no doubt heard by now,

author: captainunderoos
title: Zack Snyder Confirms Justice League 2 Connection in Batman V Superman
summary: Zack Snyder reveals a Justice League 2 tease in Batman V Superman: Dawn of Justice. As time goes by, we're learning more about the director's vision for the DCEU. Foiled by Warner Bros.' supposed meddling, Snyder had been planting seemingly unimportant Easter Eggs in his films in the hopes of a proper pay-off later on. Unfortunately, he won't be able to finish what he started considering his muddy history with the shared universe right now. The last several months, Snyder has become more vocal about his exit from Justice League. Despite the original report that he willingly stepped away from the project, eventual rumors suggested he was fired by Warner Bros., who opted for Joss Whedon's more

author: DeltaBravo
title: Star Wars: Episode IX Will Go In "Unexpected Directions"
summary: When the credits rolled on The Force Awakens, and Lucasfilm began shifting its resources over to Rogue One, no one – not even the man himself – expected J.J. Abrams to return to the Star Wars franchise. This is, after all, the same guy who resurrected a dormant giant in 2015, and though The Force Awakens played things safe with its numerous callbacks to A New Hope – the dogged Resistance, the trench run, the spherical planet killer…you name it – Star Wars: Episode IX lends Abrams the chance to toy with expectations. Speaking to Radio Times in a recent interview, the actor, who plays General Hux in the franchise, teased that Abrams may be going in some “unexpected” directions with the film. “What was brilliant [about The Last Jedi] was that it was unexpected.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: WATCH: Jeffrey Dean Morgan Becomes BATMAN In Epic Fan-Made FLASHPOINT Trailer
summary: One of the most anticipated upcoming DC movies is Flashpoint, starring Ezra Miller in his first solo vehicle as the Scarlet Speedster. The title comes with a lot of baggage in DC lore, so fans have already got a list of things they want to see in the film. And while there's a long wait until any footage from Flashpoint comes our way, one creative individual has made an awesome fan-made trailer that teases what could be on the cards. Of course, it features Jeffrey Dean Morgan as the alt-Batman, which is what every DC fan under the sun wants to see happen. The Batman V Superman star has been heavily linked with Flashpoint in the past and has gone on record to say how much he'd like to explore the

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Harry Potter: What The Cast Looked Like In The First Movie Vs Now
summary: Perhaps the most popular franchise in Hollywood history, save for maybe Star Wars, the Harry Potter books and movies have captured the imaginations of both children and adults alike. Spawning toys, clothing, and even a theme park, the magical story of a young boy who faced his greatest nightmare and lived to tell the tale featured a cast chock full of talented, well-adjusted child stars alongside bona fide British acting royalty. Beginning as adorable ragamuffin child stars, actors such as Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Tom Felton, and Bonnie Wright have grown into talented young performers, and in some cases, fearless activists. The adult Harry Potter cast was largely made up of seasoned British

author: DeltaBravo
title: Box Office: 'Jumanji' Tops $400M, 'Greatest Showman' Still Leggier Than 'Titanic'
summary: 'A Wrinkle in Time' dropped 50% in its second weekend.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Ben Affleck And Charlie Hunnam Go Shirtless While Training For New Movie On The Beach
summary: It's all work and a little play for Ben Affleck, Charlie Hunnam, Garret Hedlund and Oscar Isaac. The actors were photographed training for their new movie, “Triple Frontier”, in Hawaii on Thursday, and it seems they took full advantage of their beach spot. Affleck showed off his tattoos on the shore before diving into the ocean under the supervision of Hawaii lifeguards. Hunnam, meanwhile, showed off his toned bod in a pair of red swim trunks. The actor had fun goofing off with Hedlund on the sand, before the pair, as well as Isaac, got down to business and awaited instruction from their trainers. “Triple Frontier”, directed by JC Chandor and produced by Netflix, has had several high-profile

author: third_watch
title: Ava DuVernay Will Direct DC Comic Book Movie 'The New Gods'
summary: Ava DuVernay' is following up "A Wrinkle in Time" with a big-screen version of

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: How Doctor Strange And Iron Man Will Interact In Infinity War, According To Benedict Cumberbatch
summary: There are lots of things to be excited about in Avenger: Infinity War, one of the most hyped movies ever. It's the culmination of 10 years of blockbusters and boasts a seriously large cast of colorful characters. Seeing these different heroes interact -- many of whom have never met before -- is a major selling point for fans of the MCU. One of these pairs of characters is Doctor Strange and Iron Man, two cocky, bearded gentleman who are masters of magic and science, respectively. Sparks will likely fly, but according to Benedict Cumberbatch, these guys have bigger concerns than their egos.

author: nanook
title: Judi Dench: Dame's cold shoulder for a Russian film festival
summary: Dame Judi, 83, is still being billed as the star guest for the Sochi International Film Festival and Awards ceremony at the Soho hotel.  However, just one day after Russian father and daughter Sergei and Yulia Skripal were attacked with a nerve agent in Salisbury, she informed organisers by email that she was unable to attend but wished the event well.  A festival spokesman said her decision not to attend was not influenced by the unfolding events in the cathedral city in Wiltshire.

author: nanook
title: Elizabeth Harvest is a high-tech, twist-packed take on Bluebeard
summary: Welcome to Cheat Sheet, our brief breakdown-style reviews of festival films, VR previews, and other special event releases. This review comes from the 2018 SXSW Interactive Festival. Anybody who knows their folklore is going to be pretty clear on what's going on in the first act of Sebastian Gutierrez's Elizabeth Harvest, which had its world premiere at SXSW 2018. Henry (Ciarán Hinds), a wealthy, successful Nobel-winner, has just married wide-eyed, naïve young Elizabeth (Abbey Lee). Taking her on a tour of his luxurious home, he tells her there's just one room she must never enter. Shortly thereafter, while he's away on a business trip, her curiosity gets the better of her, and she unlocks the

author: DeltaBravo
title: When DC May Finally Start Filming Matt Reeves' Batman Movie
summary: Few DCEU solo movies have fans more excited than Matt Reeves' upcoming Batman film. The War for the Planet of the Apes director is hot off of the critical success of his latest franchise outing, and the inherent appeal of another Batman movie has piqued the interest of many fans. With that said, don't expect to see the solo Batman movie (a.k.a The Batman) debut on the big screen anytime soon, as it sounds like the film might not even begin production until sometime in 2019. The solo Batman movie has been hit with delay after delay, evolving quite a bit since the original version of the film that Ben Affleck would've helmed.

author: third_watch
title: Night of the Living Dead
summary: The synopsis: When the dead begin to rise in George A. Romero's famous 1968 zombie movie, a group of individuals take refuge in an abandoned farmhouse and try to survive the night. The twist: The sole survivor is a man named Ben (Duane Jones), who makes it to the morning, only to be mistakenly shot by soldiers who think he's one of the undead. It's a perfectly horrendous conclusion to one of the best horror movies in history. The amount of damage it'll do to your psyche: 🔪🔪🔪🔪🔪

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: 'The Beguiled' On HBO: A Welcome Reimagining Of Sexist Source Material
summary: The remake epidemic currently sweeping Hollywood is a fairly predictable one, but not one we ever suspected might reach a Coppola. When Sofia Coppola's reimagining of the 1971 drama The Beguiled hit theaters last summer, however, it became clear that some source material is totally ripe for reimagining – and that's exactly what she does with her own take on this Southern Gothic thriller. Featuring an all-star cast including the likes of Nicole Kidman, Kirsten Dunst, Colin Farrell, and Elle Fanning, Coppola's The Beguiled is proof that a fresh remake can stand on its own when done right. It's 1864 in Civil War-plagued Virginia, and Miss Martha Farnsworth's Seminary for Young Ladies is doing its

author: DeltaBravo
title: UniFrance, Miami Festival’s Third Mercado Lures Top Latin American Distributors, French Sales Agents
summary: Top Latin American distributors ranging from Brazil’s Imovision to Mexico’s Cinepolis and Colombia’s Babilla Cine flocked to the third edition of the Mercado del Cine Frances, a mini-market jointly launched by promotion organization UniFrance and Miami Film Festival. Spearheaded by UniFrance’s executives Gilles Renouard and Delphine Martin, the three-day initiative which kicked off March 10, […]

author: third_watch
title: Kanye West took Shia LaBeouf's clothes
summary: Kanye West took "all" of Shia LaBeouf's clothes. The 'Famous' rapper was pictured wearing the 'Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull' star's hat last year, with his wife Kim Kardashian West revealing it was his "favourite" piece of headwear but there was a "whole story" behind how he acquired it. Explaining how Kanye had visited his house to discuss art collaborations and asked if he could have some clothes for a pop-up shop, Shia recalled: "Around the same time, I took my mother to his concert. "She is, of course, obsessed with Kanye West.

author: third_watch
title: Best new shows and movies to stream: ‘The Beguiled,’ ‘Britannia,’ and more
summary: Need something to watch this weekend? Check out our list of the best new shows and movies to stream right now. On the list this week: Ladies First, Edha, The Theory of Everything, Britannia, and The Beguiled.

author: third_watch
title: Director Terry Gilliam Says #MeToo “Got Silly”, “Monster” Harvey Weinstein “Opened The Door” For Some
summary: Brazil director and Monty Python trouper Terry Gilliam says Hollywood has plenty of Harvey Weinstein-like “monsters” but insists the #MeToo atmosphere has “got silly,” with people “being described in ridiculous terms as if there is no real humanity left anymore.” In an interview published today by global news agency AFP, Gilliam claims that the MeToo movement has become “mob rule.” “It is a world of victims,” Gilliam says. “I think some people did very well out of meeting with Harvey and others didn't. The ones who did knew what they were doing. These are adults, we are talking about adults with a lot of ambition. “Harvey opened the door for a few people, a night with Harvey — that's the price

author: nanook
title: Christian Indie ‘I Can Only Imagine’ Set to Over-Perform at Box Office
summary: UPDATED: The nation’s moviegoers look to be turning out in bigger numbers for a Christian-themed independent film than for the first mainstream teen movie with a gay main character. Roadside Attractions-Lionsgate’s “I Can Only Imagine,” based on the story of the biggest-selling Christian song of all time, is looking at an estimated $15 million for […]

author: nanook
title: Box Office: 'I Can Only Imagine' Stuns With $6M Friday, 'Love, Simon' Nabs $4.7M
summary: The faith-based musical biopic vastly overperformed while the gay teen rom-com performed to expectations.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Vatican Releases Wim Wenders' Pope Francis Documentary Trailer (Watch)
summary: The Vatican TV Center has released a trailer for “Pope Francis – A Man of His Word,” the documentary directed by Wim Wenders, which Focus Features will release in the U.S. on May 18. There is now speculation that the film could also launch from the Cannes Film Festival. German auteur Wenders, the maker of “Wings of Desire” and documentaries such as “Buena Vista Social Club” and “Pina,” was given unprecedented access to the pope over a two-year period for “A Man of His Word.” Wenders was also able to use exclusive footage from the Vatican TV archives of Francis on his world travels. The documentary revolves around a long dialogue with the pontiff, who answers questions “about the main global challenges

author: nanook
title: What 'Call Me by Your Name' would look like with Arnold Schwarzenegger and Danny DeVito (video)
summary: Funny or Die made a mashup — titled “Call Me by Your Twins” — of the 1988 comedy film “Twins” starring DeVito and Schwarzenegger with the Oscar-nominated film “Call Me by Your Name.” And it’s amazing.

author: captainunderoos
title: Danny Boyle says new James Bond film will be inspired by Time's Up: 'It'll be written in the modern world'
summary: The James Bond franchise will differ under the direction of Danny Boyle. The Trainspotting filmmaker, who seemed to confirm his involvement in Bond 25 following the departure of Skyfall and Spectre director Sam Mendes, promised that he will look at the “modern world” when it comes to writing the role of the next Bond girl.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Dwayne Johnson's Red Notice Set for June 2020
summary: Dwayne Johnson's Red Notice set for June 2020 release date After a high profile bidding war for the film that included such major players as Warner Bros., Paramount, Sony and even Netflix, Universal Pictures won the rights to the upcoming Red Notice back in February. Now, the studio has announced they've set a June 12, 2020 release date for the action-thriller. Currently no other film is slated for that release date, but Red Notice will open between an Untitled DCEU movie on June 5, 2020 and an Untitled Pixar movie on June 19, 2020. In the film, global superstar Dwayne Johnson reteams with his Central Intelligence writer/director, Rawson Marshall Thurber, to lead the cast of Red Notice. The pair

author: nanook
title: Actor recalls Grand Slam film 40 years on
summary: On the 40th anniversary of the release of the iconic Welsh rugby film Grand Slam, actor Dewi "Pws" Morris remembers his time on set. He starred alongside Oscar-winner Hugh Griffiths and actress Sharon Morgan, in the film about a rugby fan who goes in search of an old girlfriend while on a trip to see Wales play France in the Five Nations tournament. He said "it doesn't feel like forty years" since making the film and talks about how he is still recognised in the street for his role.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Matthew Morrison 'outraged' with animal abuse on set of Chinese film
summary: Actor Matthew Morrison was shocked to learn of the animal abuse on the set of his latest Chinese film, where a puppy was locked into a cage that was suspended 20 feet into the air, violently spun around, and dumped into a freezing river. The scene is a part of the Chinese movie Crazy Alien, directed by Hao Ning, in which the Glee actor is a main character. A whistleblower on set captured the horrific moment on tape in November, alerting PETA to the animal abuse that saw a young German Shepherd bark madly, then go silent in fear once the traumatizing stunt began. The scene filmed in Changsha, China was repeated several times as the director demanded multiple takes. Speaking on the disturbing animal

author: captainunderoos
title: The Last Jedi Novelization Explains How Rey Learned the Jedi Mind Trick
summary: The novelization of Star Wars: The Last Jedi goes a long way towards fleshing out the film, including an explanation of Rey's Force abilities. Star Wars 8 has been a subject of much debate, with critical praise offset by a serious fan backlash. Luckily, new material has helped to unlock some of the movie's secrets and shine a light on some key areas. The home video release comes with several revealing deleted scenes, although those 14 clips are nothing on the novelization. For those looking for a deeper dive into the plot of the movie, The Last Jedi novelization has offered some interesting tidbits from the narrative and insights into the characters. We learn a substantial amount of Snoke's backstory,

author: captainunderoos
title: Free Movie Matinee for Seniors at Malverne Theater
summary: Nassau County Seniors are invited to a Free Movie Screening on March 21st at 11am at the Malverne Movie Theater. The movie will be Red Sparrow, the new spy movie featuring Jennifer Lawrence. Please join us! RSVP at 516-882-4498 by March 19th  This event is sponsored by Umbrella (www.askumbrella.com), the seniors helping seniors service that helps Nassau County seniors stay in their homes by connecting them to neighbors who can help with handyman jobs, chores, and more.

author: third_watch
title: Monty Python's Gilliam: 'Conman' Trump is funnier than us
summary: Monty Python's Terry Gilliam could be forgiven for thinking the whole Donald Trump presidency is a joke on him. This is a man after all who renounced his American citizenship in protest at George W. Bush. "For somebody who likes turning things upside down, I should be enjoying this -- but Trump is an idiot," said the maker of "Brazil" and "Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas".

author: DeltaBravo
title: Chinese short film festival looks to Finland for help
summary: Finland's Tampere Film Festival, one of the most important European short film festivals, has been helping a city in northwest China to develop its own cultural event. Last year, the inaugural Jinzhen International Short Film Festival was held in Hancheng, Shaanxi Province and the next is set for October. Two Jinzhen team members travelled 6,500 kilometres to southern Finland earlier this month to work as interns at the 48th edition of the long-running festival, while short films in Tampere's international competition were also eligible for the Jinzhen Film Prize—the first of five planned prizes to be awarded at festivals this year. One of the key people behind this relationship is Tampere's festival director Jukka-Pekka Laakso.

title: Marvel Drops A Slew Of HD Images For Avengers: Infinity War
summary: It's shaping up to be a busy, busy week in the Marvel camp. Amid news that Entertainment Tonight is poised to peel back the many layers of Avengers: Infinity War for a behind-the-scenes showcase, we've also caught wind that Marvel plans to double down on Joe and Anthony Russo's event movie with a new trailer reveal and maybe – just maybe – advanced ticket sales to what is surely the biggest blockbuster in Marvel Studios history. We're still waiting on word from Marvel about that last one, but in order to keep viewers chomping at the bit, the studio (h/t Marvel Studios News) has dropped nine HD (and textless!) images for Infinity War that ought to look familiar to those who ran a fine-tooth comb

title: First photos from Lifetime’s Prince Harry-Meghan Markle movie released
summary: Lifetime has released new photos from their upcoming TV-movie about Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, showing the actors playing them along with the portrayers of Prince William and Duchess Kate. “Harry & Meghan: A Royal Romance” airs May 13.

title: Eros International’s Bajrangi Bhaijaan Grosses Over $25 million in China in First 10 Days of Release
summary: Eros International Plc , a leading global company in the Indian film entertainment industry, today announced Producer Salman Khan Film’s Bajrangi Bhaijaan has collected over $25 million within ten days of its release in China.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: 'Solo: A Star Wars Story' International Posters Get Some Noteworthy Changes
summary: Solo: A Star Wars story has had a little bit of a bumpy road with its marketing. The colorful first set of posters for the upcoming movie were compared to a French artist's 2015 album covers, resulting in Disney looking into allegations of design theft. Sometimes these claims are a stretch, but in this case … yikes. It's extremely similar. So, when coming out with a new set of international posters for the Star Wars expansion film, it looks like Disney has made some adjustments. In the posters below, you'll notice that the big block lettering has been removed, and replaced with a more standard logo for the movie. And instead of being identified as “Solo,” Han is now just Han. Those are fairly

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Stormy Daniels' Estranged Dad Shares Never-Before-Seen Photos of Daughter
summary: Bill Gregory's daughter has kicked off an online fundraising campaign to help cover her legal fees as she fights to reveal the story behind her alleged affair with President Trump.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Stormy Daniels, crowdfunding her legal fight with Trump, raises more than $130,000
summary: Porn star Stormy Daniels launched a crowdfunding campaign Wednesday to help cover the cost of her legal battle against President Trump and his lawyer, Michael Cohen. It has raised more than $130,000 in a little more than a day.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Terminator 6 Receives Green Light, To Film This June
summary: Thanks to the combined efforts of Tim Miller (Deadpool), James Cameron (Avatar) and Paramount Pictures, Skynet is currently being reprogrammed ahead of the forthcoming Terminator reboot. Though it was originally expected to enter production this month, screenwriter Billy Ray has confirmed via Twitter that Miller's franchise revival is now on course to begin filming in June (as expected), after the project finally received the green light from the studio earlier this week. Not that anyone thought it would be placed back on the shelf, mind you, but until now, it technically wasn't official. As such, it's nice to get the confirmation from Billy and with production set for June, we imagine that casting

author: DeltaBravo
title: 65 New Titles Coming to Netflix in March That Will Keep You Entertained All Month Long
summary: While Mother Nature slowly begins to heat things up this Winter, Netflix is following suit. This March, there are a handful of exciting new titles arriving. The sexy drama Cruel Intentions will be available to stream, while tons of Netflix original shows like Jessica Jones and A Series of Unfortunate Events will be back for another season. See what else is in store next month below.
